title: dependence_plot for data with multiple labels error
body:
I am plotting the dependence of two variables for one label in a multi-label dataset.
The offensive code is:
`shap.dependence_plot('SOME_VALUE', shap_values[cls][idx_cls, :], X.iloc[idx_cls])`

`cls` is the index of the class (an int) and `idx_cls` is an array of indices where the label was `cls`.

Now, there is an output plot, but without any labels, and the cell throws an `IndexError`. Here's the full error:

```---------------------------------------------------------------------------
IndexError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-47-b3e2be1f755c> in <module>
      4 
      5 shap.dependence_plot('SOME_VALUE', shap_values[cls][idx_cls, :], 
----> 6                      X.iloc[idx_cls])

~/anaconda3/envs/valley/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/plots/dependence.py in dependence_plot(ind, shap_values, features, feature_names, display_features, interaction_index, color, axis_color, dot_size, x_jitter, alpha, title, xmin, xmax, show)
    242             xlim[0] * np.ones(xv_nan.sum()), s[xv_nan], marker=1,
    243             linewidth=2, c=cvals_imp[xv_nan], cmap=colors.red_blue, alpha=alpha,
--> 244             vmin=clow, vmax=chigh
    245         )
    246         p.set_array(cvals[xv_nan])

~/anaconda3/envs/valley/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/pyplot.py in scatter(x, y, s, c, marker, cmap, norm, vmin, vmax, alpha, linewidths, verts, edgecolors, data, **kwargs)
   2862         vmin=vmin, vmax=vmax, alpha=alpha, linewidths=linewidths,
   2863         verts=verts, edgecolors=edgecolors, **({"data": data} if data
-> 2864         is not None else {}), **kwargs)
   2865     sci(__ret)
   2866     return __ret

~/anaconda3/envs/valley/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/__init__.py in inner(ax, data, *args, **kwargs)
   1803                         "the Matplotlib list!)" % (label_namer, func.__name__),
   1804                         RuntimeWarning, stacklevel=2)
-> 1805             return func(ax, *args, **kwargs)
   1806 
   1807         inner.__doc__ = _add_data_doc(inner.__doc__,

~/anaconda3/envs/valley/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/axes/_axes.py in scatter(self, x, y, s, c, marker, cmap, norm, vmin, vmax, alpha, linewidths, verts, edgecolors, **kwargs)
   4193                 isinstance(c, str) or
   4194                 (isinstance(c, collections.Iterable) and
-> 4195                     isinstance(c[0], str))):
   4196             c_array = None
   4197         else:

IndexError: index 0 is out of bounds for axis 0 with size 0
```

It looks like a matplotlib problem but I cannot figure our what it is.
Thanks
